[[Image:Seal of the University of Santo Tomas.svg|right|220px|Seal of the University of Santo Tomas]]
 
The streets within the [[Manila]] campus of the [[University of Santo Tomas]] were completely unnamed for 32 years since the University transferred from [[Intramuros]].<ref>[http://www.varsitarian.net/features/who_cares_about_ust%E2%80%99s_streets Who cares about USTâs streets?]. Retrieved 26 January 2011.</ref> In 1960, the street signs and names inside the University were inaugurated after a student initiative and majority of which were named after Thomasian Alumni. As of January 2011, there are 19 named roads including Intramuros Drive, Rizal Lane, and Quezon Drive.
The streets within the [[Manila]] campus of the [[University of Santo Tomas]] were completely unnamed for 32 years since the University transferred from [[Intramuros]].<ref>[http://www.varsitarian.net/features/who_cares_about_ust%E2%80%99s_streets Who cares about USTâs streets?]. Retrieved 26 January 2011.</ref> In 1960, the street signs and names inside the University were inaugurated after a student initiative and majority of which were named after Thomasian Alumni. As of January 2011, there are 19 named roads including Intramuros Drive, Rizal Lane, and Quezon Drive.
